briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Remimazolam in ASA III and IV Patients Undergoing Colonoscopy
officialTitle: A Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Remimazolam (CNS 7056) Compared to Placebo and Midazolam in ASA III and IV Patients Undergoing Colonoscopy
summary: A prospective, double-blind, randomized, placebo and active controlled, multi-center, parallel group study comparing remimazolam to placebo, with an additional open-label arm for midazolam, in American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Grade III and IV patients (ASA status evaluated by an anesthesiologist not otherwise involved in the study) undergoing a colonoscopy for diagnostic or therapeutic reasons.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From first dose of study drug until the end of colonoscopy
